toc.envision_location: Eiffel ENViSioN!\Developing with Eiffel ENViSioN!\Adding a New Project\Advanced GUI Project Wizard\Interface Construction Page\How To's

paragraph.paragraph:
An EiffelBuild
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object is a representation of a Vision2 component and its properties.

To create a new instance of an object,
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop pick a type from the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/30_type_selector/index.xml type selector and
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop drop onto an existing
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object (Accessible from the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/20_layout_constructor/index.xml layout constructor or
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/60_builder_window/index.xml builder window ). You will only be able to complete the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop drop if the targeted
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object will accept a new object of the transported type.
paragraph.note:
Note: Once an
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object has been
/tools/eiffelbuild/how_to_s/20_create_an_object/index.xml created , it will always be contained in a parent
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object until
/tools/eiffelbuild/how_to_s/30_delete_an_object/index.xml deleted .
paragraph.heading: 2Creating Window and Dialog Objects
paragraph.paragraph: Window and dialog objects are created by picking a type from the ../../reference/30_type_selector/index.xmltype selector and dropping into the ../../reference/64_widget_selector/index.xmlwidget selector. If the target of the drop is a directory within the widget selector, the new object is created within that directory, otherwise in the root of the project location.
paragraph.note: Note If there are no other windows or directories in the project, the newly created object is set as the root window.
